resources.string: \tThe %1$s application is designed to help decode cryptogram sent by a serial killer, known as the Zodiac Killer, to the local Bay Area press on November 8, 1969.\n\tThe cryptogram has not been definitively solved and the killer\'s identity remains unknown to this day.

\tTo substitute a letter for a symbol in cryptogram tap on the symbol and type the letter in the dialog. The symbols will be then automatically replaced by the specified letter in every place it is located.

\tClick on the \"%1$s\" button to remember the binding, i.e. the correspondence between symbols in the cipher and the letters.\n\tUse the \"%2$s\" button to return to the remembered binding.\n\tClick on the \"%3$s\" to remove all the letters.

Click on the "%1$s" button to show the search dialog.
	Searching words means finding bindings that make the cipher contain these words.
	There are following search parameters:
	%2$s - the results must not contradict the current binding.
	%3$s - different symbols can be replaced by the same letter.
	Search Directions - directions in which the words are searched.
\tNOTE! The search can be a very resource-consuming operation. It is not recommended to search for more than one word, especially on the old devices.
